current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for additional enhancements of the sexual assault prevention and response activities of the Armed Forces.

header.#text:
Additional
		enhancements of military department actions on sexual assault prevention and
		response

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (as added by
), a Special Victims’ Counsel designated under

shall provide advice to victims of sexual assault on the advantages and

text.#text: In addition to any duties authorized by

header.#text:
Additional duty
		of Special Victims' Counsel

Consultation
		with victims regarding preference in prosecution of certain sexual
		offenses

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall each
		establish a process to ensure consultation with the victim of a covered sexual
		offense that occurs in the United States with respect to the victim's
		preference as to whether the offense should be prosecuted by court-martial or
		by a civilian court with jurisdiction over the offense.

header.#text:
In
		general

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to the prosecution of an offense, while not binding, should be
		afforded great weight in the determination whether to prosecute the offense by
		court-martial or by a civilian court.

text.#text: The preference expressed by a victim under

header.#text:
Weight afforded
		preference

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in favor of prosecution of an offence by civilian court and the
		civilian authorities determine to decline prosecution, or defer to prosecution
		by court-martial, the victim shall be promptly notified of that
		determination.

text.#text: In the event a victim expresses a preference under

header.#text:
Notice to
		victim of lack of civilian criminal prosecution after preference for such
		prosecution

Performance
		appraisals of members of the Armed Forces

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall each
		ensure that the written performance appraisals of members of the Armed Forces
		(whether officers or enlisted members) under the jurisdiction of such Secretary
		include an assessment of the extent to which each such member supports the sexual assault
		prevention and response program of the Armed Force concerned.

header.#text:
Appraisals of
		all members on compliance with sexual assault prevention and response
		programs

Performance
		appraisals of commanding officers

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military
		departments shall each ensure that the performance appraisals of commanding
		officers under the jurisdiction of such Secretary indicate the extent to which each such
		commanding officer has or has not established a command climate in which—

allegations of
		sexual assault are properly managed and fairly evaluated; and

a
		victim can report criminal activity, including sexual assault, without fear of
		retaliation, including ostracism and group pressure from other members of the
		command.

header.#text:
Command climate
		assessments following incidents of certain sexual offenses

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall each
		establish a process whereby a command climate assessment is performed following
		an incident involving a covered sexual offense for each of the command of the
		accused and the command of the victim. If the accused and the victim are within
		the same command, only a single climate assessment is required. The process
		shall ensure the timely completion of command climate assessments for provision
		to military criminal investigation organizations and commanders pursuant to

header.#text:
Assessments
		required

Provision to
		military criminal investigation organizations and commanders

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be
		provided to the following:

text.#text:
A
		command climate assessment performed pursuant to

The military
		criminal investigation organization conducting the investigation of the offense
		concerned.

The commander
		next higher in the chain of command of the command covered by the climate
		assessment.

header.#text:
Confidential
		review of characterization of terms of discharge of victims of sexual
		offenses

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall each
		establish a confidential process, through boards for the correction of military
		records of the military department concerned, by which an individual who was
		the victim of a covered sexual offense during service in the Armed Forces may
		challenge, on the basis of being the victim of such an offense, the terms or
		characterization of the individual's discharge or separation from the Armed
		Forces.

header.#text:
In
		general

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Secretary of
		the military department concerned shall instruct boards to give due
		consideration to the psychological and physical aspects of the individual’s
		experience in connection with the offense concerned, and to what bearing such
		experience may have had on the circumstances surrounding the individual's
		discharge or separation from the Armed Forces.

text.#text:
In deciding
		whether to modify the terms or characterization of an individual's discharge or
		separation pursuant to the process required by

header.#text:
Consideration
		of individual experiences in connection with offenses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not be made available
		to the public, except with the consent of the individual concerned.

text.#text:
An
		attempt to commit an offense specified in

Not later than 180 days
		after the date of the enactment of this Act, Rule 404(a) of the Military Rules
		of Evidence shall be modified to clarify that the general military character of
		an accused is not admissible for the purpose of showing the probability of
		innocence of the accused, except that evidence of a trait of the military
		character of an accused may be offered in evidence by the accused when that
		trait is relevant to an element of an offense for which the accused has been
		charged.

header.#text:
Modification of
		Military Rules of Evidence relating to admissibility of general military
		character toward probability of innocence

Applicability

(as amended by this Act) and this Act apply to the United
		States Military Academy, the Naval Academy, and the Air Force Academy, as
		applicable.

text.#text: It is the sense of the Senate that—

header.#text: Sense of Senate on independent panel on review and assessment on response systems to sexual assault crimes

text.#text: the panel to review and assess the systems used to respond to sexual assault established by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is conducting an independent assessment of the systems used to investigate, prosecute, and adjudicate crimes involving adult sexual assault and related offenses;
